title: Unit 1 Checkpoint: Linear Systems & Matrices
description: Cumulative assessment covering systems of equations (substitution, elimination, special cases), systems of inequalities, mathematical modeling with systems, matrix operations, and solving systems with inverse matrices.

remediationResources.focusArea: Choosing methods, messy coefficients, special cases
Graphing regions, boundary lines, test points
Defining variables, writing equations from context, interpreting solutions

assessmentProblems.question: Solve by substitution: y = 3x + 2 and 6x - 2y = 8. Classify the system.
A concert sold 300 tickets. Adult tickets cost $12 and student tickets cost $8. Total revenue was $2960. How many of each were sold?
Graph the solution region: y ≤ 2x + 1, y > -x + 4, x ≥ 0. Identify the vertices of the solution region.
Find the determinant and inverse of A = [3 1; 5 2].
Use an inverse matrix to solve: 3x + y = 10 and 5x + 2y = 17.
A chemist needs 10 liters of a 30% acid solution. She has a 20% solution and a 50% solution. How many liters of each should she mix?
The determinant of a 2×2 matrix is 0. What does this mean about the system of equations it represents?
assessmentProblems.answer: The system has no unique solution. It is either inconsistent (no solution) or dependent (infinitely many solutions). The matrix is singular and has no inverse.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve the system: x + y + z = 6, 2x - y + z = 3, x + 2y - z = 2.
